Engine Simulation

Engine Simulation contains any engine simulation components in the FPGA that you add. Engine simulation defines the Crank and Cams to be simulated and defines the measurements to be made on ECU Events such as fuel injectors and ignition coils.

What do you want to do?

Change FPGA address

To change the FPGA target address, change the value in the control FPGA Name found on the page below. You can only change the FPGA address if the custom device does not reference an NI VeriStand FPGA. To change an NI VeriStand FPGA's address, you must select the FPGA from the tree.

View or change the angle processing unit

To view or change the angle processing unit, select the Angle Processing Unit item in the configuration tree. The Angle Processing Unit page appears to the right of the configuration tree.

View or change crank and cams

To view or change the crank and cams, select the Crank and Cams item in the configuration tree. The Crank and Cams page appears to the right of the configuration tree.

View or change ECU events

To view or change the ECU events, select the ECU Events item in the configuration tree. The ECU Events page appears to the right of the configuration tree.

For more information about adding and configuring custom devices, refer to the Configuring and Running a Project book of the NI VeriStand Help, available by selecting Help»Search the NI VeriStand Help.
